1. As countries develop, their populations tend to live individually or in small family units.

What are the causes of this trend and what are the effects on society？

https://writing9.com/text/5f1f8d7a308b920018b746f8

Nowadays, the economy and technology grow so fast in many countries, so there is a fair amount of residents who prefer to live individually or in small groups rather than to live in big communities. This essay is going to discuss what the causes of this trend are as well as what the impacts on those nations are.

Regarding the causes, there are two main reasons that contribute to the development of this style. Firstly, people do not have time to communicate with others, such as the workers are extremely busy at work and tired post their shift. Consequently, they really want to relax and be lonely without playing with others. Additionally, each person in this modern society has their own smart device, such as smartphones, tablets, or laptops. They tend to focus on their personal devices even when meeting other people. 50 percent of young people will tend to live individually if they usually use a smartphone while meeting friends, according to the research from Harvard University.

The trend will bring some negative impacts on the society of nations which are experiencing this. Firstly, the family connection will be loosening because of this lifestyle. For example, a son or a daughter who did not talk to their parents for a while because of living far from their parents will lose connection easily. Furthermore, people who do not want to be exposed to society will get stress easier than the opposite ones. As a result, those ones tend to find death because they feel stressed and they do not know which ones they should share feelings with. According to recent research, 30% of the young generation in Korea is feeling stressed and they used to think about death.

In conclusion, having heavy workloads and abusing smart devices are the reasons that lead to the growth of living in small family groups in this modern world. This not only negatively affects the connection between parents and children, but it also impacts on the mental health of the young generation.

2. Some people think that with the increasing use of mobile phones and computers, people lose the ability to communicate face to face.

To what extent do you agree or disagree?

https://writing9.com/text/6183b4f4ed99dc0019405e60-some-people-think-that-with-the-increasing-use-of-mobile

Recent years have seen a dramatic boom in smartphone and PC use, contributing to the worry that the ability to make facial contact with others has been lost. In my view, the face to face talking skills are not undermined, as there is still a range of situations where physical conversations cannot be replaced by online ones.

To begin with, it is considerably more efficient to accomplish tasks in the workplace via facial conversations than communicate just online. Misunderstandings probably tend to occur by literally talking because the tone of the speaker is unknown. Even if online conferencing is available, it is not as convenient as arranging a meeting physically due to the possibility of not being able to catch up on the internet. For instance, though the zoom app, an application that helps you to set up online meetings both through cellphones and laptops, is extremely popular all over the world especially with the pandemic going on, managers still make huge efforts to urge their staff to return to the office buildings.

In addition, informal communications with friends and families are so frequent and easy that they hardly could give way to chatting on the internet. Friends and families are those people whom you live with or meet nearly every day. Although sometimes you may be apart, for example, having a business journey, the getting-together time constitutes the majority. Therefore, having a video talk with them on mobile phone applications or on computer software may relieve the miss to them, it is a tiny part generally.

In conclusion, it is not necessary to be anxious that people cannot communicate with others ficially, because online talking only composes an insignificant piece of people's whole lives. Thus, the computer and cellphone impossibly could make people unable to make face to face conversations.

3. Some countries achieve international success by building specialized facilities to train top athletes instead of providing sports facilities that everyone can use.

Do you think it is a positive or negative development？

https://ieltspracticeonline.com/ielts-writing-task-2-sports-facilities/

Heavy investment in sports facilities aimed at professional athletes is common in countries that want to compete in international events. This is a positive development for national pride but negative on the whole as it takes funding away from the average citizen.

Proponents of this practice would argue that it brings the nation together. The best examples of this relate to international competitions like the summer and winter Olympics. China and the United States have famously invested millions in building sports facilities for prospective Olympians and the results in terms of medals justify the expenditure. The wider implications for national unity come from an entire country watching the telecasts and rooting together. Divisive domestic disputes are temporarily forgotten as everyone focuses on the progress of their country. Much of this would be impossible without specialized sports facilities for the best competitors.

However, these facilities benefit a selected few over the majority. Funding for such facilities is a limited part of a federal budget that must cover essential areas like health, education, and the military. Any money diverted towards preparing world-class athletes for international competitions is to some extent a waste as it cuts into the budget for facilities for average people. For example, many inner city youths in poorer neighborhoods lack access to parks and such facilities and this has been identified as one of the factors that allows for poverty to be inherited over generations. Direct the funding away from these expensive gyms for top athletes and it would be possible to build many more facilities that serve a much wider and underserved segment of the population.

In conclusion, despite the less tangible benefits to national cohesiveness, this is a negative on level as it favors a talented minority. More resources should be allocated towards facilities for those in greater need.

https://writing9.com/text/5ff1645b2f480d00117acdac-some-countries-achieve-international-success-by-building-specialized-facilities-to

Numerous nations are becoming successful at the international platform by providing training to their best athletes instead of working on improving facilities for everybody. I am of the opinion that it has many drawbacks and it will be justified in the following paragraphs.

First and foremost, many nations are nowadays focussing on building facilities to train a few athletes for international competitions. Therefore, people who have inborn talents can only reach the top of the list and can get further training for the bigger events. As a result, only a few will be rewarded with the training and others who could have performed better with some guidance will not be able to do so. And they will feel devastated and dejected. Moreover, they will lose hope and may start looking for another option for living. For instance, only 11 players can play in an international team of any country and only 16 get an opportunity to be selected in a team. These numbers are too low to motivate other players to work hard on their own to vie for the national team.

In addition to that, if facilities at ground level are not improved then soon the craze for sports will be lost and very few people would try to play in the national team. This reduction in passion will ultimately affect the quality of the players at the national level and hence this will hamper their success at international platforms. To exemplify, in a developing country such as India, approximately 80% of children play some games and this reduces to 10% when they cross adolescents and hardly 1% amongst them try to pursue their career in sports. It is just because of the negligence of sports facilities and training at ground level; they start losing their interest in sports.

To conclude, although many nations have tasted success in international competitions by just focussing on their best athletes, this trend is temporary.  People will start losing their interest in games if they do not get attention from governments in terms of facilities and soon it will have a huge negative impact on the talent of athletes.

4. Some people believe that the main benefit of international cooperation is in the environment, others maintain that the major profit is the development of world business.

Discuss both views and give your own opinion.

https://writing9.com/text/6139d2972b4348001866e461-some-people-believe-that-the-main-benefit-of-international-cooperation

Some people consider that global cooperation is more profitable for trade and corporations, while others believe that it has the main benefits to the environment. In my view, I hold the opinion that  globalization has much more positive effects on business than that on the environment.

On the one hand, with the expansion of world manufactures that cause many kinds of pollution, the impacts to the natural environment are unavoidable. Due to the construction of factories, the damages to the ecosystem such as deforestation and green gas emission are heavily rising. For example, many developed countries' costume manufacturers build their factories in Third World nations that have fragile ecosystems. As a consequence, the forests are disappearing; the water resources such as freshwater lakes and rivers are reducing; the glaciers are retreating year by year due to  climate change.

On the other hand, the process of globalization has helped many businesses to develop their scale of trade. Firstly, owing to international cooperation, the commercial fields have had a larger scale of access to labor and new markets in diverse areas, along with providing people from all over the world with more chances for employment. Secondly, increased globalization promotes the spread of knowledge, technology and talents. For instance, the mobile phone industries in China have expanded their market, factories and techniques globally, with the cognition of international trade and communication. As for the profits, Chinese mobile phone companies have grown their businesses overseas, especially in poor regions of developing countries, therefore helping them to develop their economy while the manufacturers could have lower cost of production.

In conclusion, the increase of international relationships absolutely helped the growth of commercial organizations. However, the surroundings are damaged seriously by modern industries at the same position.

5. Some people think that getting old is a negative thing, whereas others think it is much easier for people to live in modern society.

Discuss both views and give your own opinion.

https://writing9.com/text/614c88f838762d0018fc19df-some-people-think-that-getting-old-is-a-negative-thing

Nowadays, an aging society is a noticeable issue. Some people have the fear of getting old while others think it is not a serious problem in this modern world. In my opinion, I agree with the latter one, and I will analyze both ideas in this essay.

On the one hand, it is obvious that older groups in this society have many inconvenient aspects in their daily lives. Firstly, the physical abilities of old people have an extreme decline, such as eyesight, hearing, and daily movement. The degradation of the physical body also causes many kinds of diseases, therefore their living standard would be unsatisfied due to the unavoidable medical problems. Secondly, because the speed of reaction and body function has decreased largely, older people can not enjoy many sports and games as well as their younger period, especially the extreme sports such as skydiving and skateboarding, even swimming and jogging. In such a situation, older groups have less enjoyment than younger ones.

On the other hand, the health care systems and technological facilities are advanced significantly compared with decades ago. For example, the life span of human beings is longer than that in the past, due to the construction of hospital infrastructures and health-related welfare systems. Old populations can get more consideration from social charities and governments. Furthermore, modern technology is getting more and more intelligent, along with the invention of artificial intelligence, such as health care robots that can help aging populations overcome inconvenience and loneliness in their life. Therefore, there are plenty of expectations in modern society for helping aging groups to live more joyfully in the future.

To conclude, although aging is an inevitable factor in an individual's life, with the progress of technology and well-being facilities, the aging public will live easier and more conveniently than ever before.
